column4: if I edit grub's 'menu.lst', is there anything else I have to do to make my changes take effect?
is there anything I can do to make ubuntu realise I have plugged in a mouse?
is it plugged in all the way?
I have touchpad, I want mouse, so I plug it in... nothing happens
but if I boot with mouse in, mouse works and no touchpad
that might be a BIOS thing
it works with other operating systems
unless the mouse and touchpad are using different modules...
but then I wonder why both dont' work at once
I don't think they use different modules...
can I unload / reload the kernel module in some way/
have you looked at the Linux on Laptops page?
even if I restart gdm and remove/re-add module "psmouse" it still stays on the touchpad when I want to use the cord mouse
so maybe it is a bios thing :/
